Detailed Description

Used by a plugin to retrieve basic values from the main compiler.

Member Function Documentation

virtual bool Syntax::Compiler::ICompiler::SettingExists ( const std::wstring &  setting  )  const [pure virtual]

Can be used to determine if a setting exists.

Settings can be specified in the source xml file in Setting tags, or they can be passed in on the command line.

virtual const std::wstring* Syntax::Compiler::ICompiler::GetSettingValue ( const std::wstring &  setting  )  const [pure virtual]

Get the value for a setting. Returns NULL if the setting doesnt exist.

If a value isnt specified, will return an empty string. This can happen if a value is passed in on the command line with no value(i.e. SyntaxCompiler data.xml rebuild). rebuild would have an empty string as a value in this example. Can also happen if there is no value specified in the setting tag of an xml setting.

virtual void Syntax::Compiler::ICompiler::AddSetting ( const std::wstring &  name,
const std::wstring &  value 
) [pure virtual]

Add a new setting to the compiler. Not normally called from a plugin.

If a setting already exists, its value will be replaced.
